Sentencas: The oxidation of hydrogen at the interface between different metallic (Ni, Pt, Ag and Au) point contact electrodes and the proton conductor Sr0.995Ce0.95Y0.05O2.970 (SCY) at temperatures of 600-800 degreesC was investigated by impedance spectroscopy in atmospheres containing from 1 to 9% of hydrogen and 1% water vapour, conditions relevant to the operation of solid oxide fuel cells and other high-temperature electrochemical devices.
Titulo: Investigation of hydrogen oxidation reaction on a metal/perovskite proton conductor interface by impedance spectroscopy

Sentencas: The high frequency bulk resistance, and polarisation resistance R, were resolved and studied as a function of hydrogen concentration and temperature.
Titulo: Investigation of hydrogen oxidation reaction on a metal/perovskite proton conductor interface by impedance spectroscopy

Sentencas: The slopes - d{log R-p)}/d{log(P-H2)} depend on the electrode, suggesting that the reaction mechanism is decisively determined by the nature of the electrode.
Titulo: Investigation of hydrogen oxidation reaction on a metal/perovskite proton conductor interface by impedance spectroscopy

Sentencas: The strongest dependence on P-H2 was found for Ni, the lowest for Au.
Titulo: Investigation of hydrogen oxidation reaction on a metal/perovskite proton conductor interface by impedance spectroscopy

Sentencas: The empirical activation energy of R, was affected by the nature of the electrode, and was found to be higher for Ag and Au than for Ni and Pt.
Titulo: Investigation of hydrogen oxidation reaction on a metal/perovskite proton conductor interface by impedance spectroscopy

Sentencas: The results were compared with those obtained earlier by quasi-steady-state current-voltage measurements.
Titulo: Investigation of hydrogen oxidation reaction on a metal/perovskite proton conductor interface by impedance spectroscopy
